channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Footpaths partly blocked, 24th February
item.description:
This footpath, when extended down to Pointer Close, has several sections whereby overhanging brambles, tree branches and ground level bushes should be cut back to provide full pavement-width access for pedestrians . These paths are in regular use and passing users have to quite often step into the road. These paths are next to school access roads and busy bus routes !
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Copperfield Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous footpath, 24th February
item.description:
This footpath between the care home and the school is treacherous to use. Last autumn's leaves were never cleared away and much rain has made the surface very slippery (Peabody's vehicles sometimes use it as a shortcut !). Consequently the leaves have become compacted and, together with the adjacent tree roots breaking the surface, make the footpath very dangerous in my opinion.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Copperfield Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lights not working., 24th February
item.description:
There are eight lights in this area adjacent to Castilion School side gates yet only two are working (MW056 and MWO57).
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Copperfield Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hazardous waste disposal, 24th February
item.description:
There has been an increase in post-renovation waste disposal along this road, residents have spotted tradesmen flytipping items like mattresses. A resident has recently renovated their drive way and this appeared not to far away from their house. It looks like cement which is hazaradous for people walking or cycling at night. In addition, when it falls onto the road it will be hazardous to drivers. CCTV could be a solution

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Andrews Close, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Presence of an offensive graffiti - Bus Stop F, 24th February
item.description:
I am reporting the presence of an offensive graffiti at the following location: Bus stop F Shelter- Outside the Portland hospital 205-209 Great Portland Street London W1W 5AH

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 205-209, Great Portland Street, Marylebone, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Group 1 Volkswagen dealership parking on double yellows, 24th February
item.description:
I have reported this so many times now. There is double yellow lines for a reason and you have group one Volkswagen dealership parking their vehicles on double yellow lines causing an obstruction. These vehicles are left there all day long and it makes dangerous for cars pulling out from the side roads as the visibility is reduced.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Avondale Road, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog poor bags, 23rd February
item.description:
These are probably used. Someone seems to come here often and keep dumping them as it's all the same bags.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mountain Bike / BMX track, Southend, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Keep Clear Box, 23rd February
item.description:
Many residents have complained for a while about how difficult it is to get out of the road when it is busy. A keep clear box on Masons Hill to allow easy exit out of Cromwell Avenue would be beneficial.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cromwell Avenue, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping in bin enclosure outside Dawes House, 23rd February
item.description:
The flytipping took place on 23/2/2026. I heard a lot of noise and went outside to see what was going on, and saw someone get into a large white box van that had been parked right in front of the rubbish disposal area where the goods had been flytipped. They then drove away towards the exit onto Orb Street. The time was about 23:14. The flytipped goods have filled the entire rubbish area and include a mattress, a bedframe, a cupboard, rolled up carpet, various plastic bags and wooden planks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Orb Street, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Chesterfield Grove Along Wall of Joe the Juice shop (opposite the car wash)-Flytipping- 5th Complaint, 23rd February
item.description:
5th Complaint: A large cardboard box iand a large metal shelf with sharp edges dumped has now been added to the pile. They both can fall on pedestrians. There are 2 pellats that could also fall on pedestrians. 2 chairs dumped, where one has been blown over and could have hurt pedestrians. (10th complaint) where furniture should be appropriately disposed of, in addition to a black bag. It is completely unacceptable that this is a site for dumping of rubbish and nothing is being done about the removal of them, which will encourage more flytipping. The Duty of Care is not being demonstrated of not enforcing the law towards the organisation in regards to the responsible manner of rubbish disposal/removal. Health and safety of the residents and wider community should be paramount, not ignored.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Chesterfield Grove, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole, 23rd February
item.description:
Very large pothole which can be impossible to avoid due to parked cars. This pothole will cause significant damage to vehicles and possible pedestrians injuries. The pot hole is on the road but closest to the even door numbers.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Beeches, North Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sewage spilling, 23rd February
item.description:
There are severe drainage issues which after several weeks have not been fixed. Raw sewage is sitting in the driveway not draining. No attempt to clear the blockage has been made and it poses a serious health risk to young families living nearby.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Emba Street, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Millfields road from Millfields Cafe/Park all the way up Every 5 meters approx a different pile of poo, 23rd February
item.description:
There is a different pile of dog foul every 5 meters all the way up on almost every tree on Millfields road up from the Millfields Cafe in E5 . Its unacceptable . Children walking, running and scooting from home to Millfields Community school and Park .
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Millfields Road, Hackney, London
